results.title: Marketing Manager
results.description:
About Medimap

We're transforming the way patients connect with healthcare providers by building a one-stop shop for easy access to care in their community. Founded in 2015, Medimap is the leading healthcare navigation platform in Canada and has been used by more than 12 Million Canadians. Following our recent funding we're rapidly expanding across geographies and markets and looking for talented individuals who have a passion for helping others.

About You

You are well versed at laying out strategies at the 10,000-foot view and then diving into the weeds and rolling up your sleeves to experiment and execute ideas. You'll optimize marketing campaigns across all channels to lead a campaign from conception to full execution. With a strong grasp of concepts on marketing tools, strategies, and integrated digital marketing campaigns, you will ensure that campaigns launch on time and within budget.

With the ultimate goal of growing our brand's loyalty and awareness across Canada, you will also get to build marketing best practices and protocols, laying the foundation for years to come.

A typical week in the life of the Marketing Manager looks like

  • Planning and executing all web, SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media, and display advertising campaigns
  • Designing, implementing, and maintaining a strong social media presence
  • Measuring and reporting on digital marketing campaign performances, and assessing these against ROI and KPIs
  • Optimizing total spend and performance based on trend insights
  • Brainstorming new and creative growth strategies
  • Planning and executing experiments and conversion tests
  • Creating our landing pages and optimizing user experience by collaborating with internal teams
  • Evaluating end-to-end customer experience using an analytical ability by looking across multiple channels
  • Constantly providing thought leadership, support, and on-going partnership
  • Managing and staying on top of marketing expenses and budget

What you have:

  • A Bachelor's degree or similar education in marketing or equivalent experience in a relevant field
  • A minimum of 5 years' experience in a digital marketing position
  • Knowledge of key marketing channels: email, advertising, SEO, website and blog management, ppc and others.
  • In-depth knowledge of various social media platforms, best practices, and website analytics.
  • Highly creative with excellent analytical abilities
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
  • Up-to-date on the latest trends and technologies in digital marketing.
  • The ability to work independently in a remote environment

 

This is a 12 month contract position that can lead to full-time.

results.title: Marketing Operations and Insights Senior Manager
results.description:
Sonatype is the software supply chain management company. We're on a mission to change how the world innovates by making software development easier. From running the world's largest repository of Java open source components (Maven Central) to inventing componentized software development, and then software supply chain management, to creating the only solution that stops malicious open-source malware in its tracks, we're constantly leading the industry while helping thousands of customers manage open source every day.

Already used by 15 million developers, we have lofty goals for our technology to be in the hands of every engineering team. And, we need you to do that. Join us!

Learn more at www.sonatype.com.


The Marketing Operations and Insights Senior Manager role will help us in our mission by reporting, analyzing and managing the performance of critical initiatives that help grow and scale our business. Your role will be dynamic and fast-paced and will require working collaboratively across the marketing function to oversee high-impact program deployment through comprehensive performance reporting. This person will be instrumental in the future of the function and provide insights to stakeholders to prove value, shape future campaigns and inform overall marketing strategy.
If you are adept at hard analytical and soft people skills, and able to adapt to rapidly changing business needs, then this job can provide a great deal of personal satisfaction. Strengths in business process assessment, project management, measurement and re-engineering are key, as is the ability to leverage technology to implement business solutions. This is a "roll up your sleeves" organizational role; the successful candidate is expected to perform all functions from administrative processing to supporting and leading strategic change initiatives within marketing.


What You Will Do:
  • Work cross-functionally with the marketing team, finance and sales operations to support marketers with strategy, project coordination, budget tracking, execution, and regular performance review for key, multi-channel, marketing initiatives.
  • Manage alignment to finance for efficient budget management and ROMI analysis.
  • Understand and deliver reporting to advise pipeline forecasting (and related company performance) and annual planning initiatives.
  • Lead tracking the efficacy of marketing initiatives and help implement the appropriate reporting and metrics to ensure desired results are being achieved and communicated to leadership.
  • Proactive identification of issues that could impact the successful growth thesis of the marketing function.


Who You Are:
  • Bachelor’s degree; MBA preferred.
  • 3+ years’ consulting, analytical, and/or marketing operations experience.
  • Solid project management skills, having managed and successfully delivered multiple, sophisticated cross-functional projects on-time and on-budget.
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills.
  • Proven track record of project delivery, interacting with all levels of management.
  • Coordinate interactions amongst and support to the marketing (and GTM) leadership team as needed (e.g. be lead on setting agendas for offsites, coordinating board meeting preparations).


What We Are Proud Of:
  • Fast Company Top 50 Companies for Innovators 2018, 2019, and 2020
  • 2019 Best Places to Work Washington Post and Washingtonian
  • 2019 Wealthfront Top Career Launch Company
  • EY Entrepreneur of the Year 2019
  • Diversity & Inclusion Working Groups
  • Parental Leave Policy
  • Paid Volunteer Time Off (VTO)

results.title: Marketing & Communications Intern
results.description:
We’re looking for a creative, hands-on Marketing Intern to support our Brand and Communications team.

Are you 24/7 scrolling through social media? Are you known for always being up to date on the latest trends and influencers? Are you already thinking that this job ad would have worked better as a video?
Smiler is a brand that is driven by the need to create – we’re capturing hundreds of photos every hour, for thousands of people around the world, all in an effort to preserve the moments that matter most.
That’s why we’re looking for a young gun that is driven by the same obsessive need to ideate, create and generate. Whether it’s words, videos or visuals, this is more than just making sure the pixels are perfect or the grammar is great. If your brain is like a firehose of ideas, you’re passionate about travel and/or photography, and you’re still reading this after that firehose brain metaphor, we would love to hear from you.
This role will have the opportunity to shape, build and execute global communication campaigns as part of the team that develops, coordinates and executes Smiler’s marketing and communications worldwide.

 

What will you do:

  • Work as part of our Brand team to develop content concepts and strategies for customer and photographer audiences

  • Come up with creative still and video concepts for Instagram, TikTok, Linkedin and Facebook

  • Act as guardian and protector of our social media accounts and engage with our audience

  • Respond to queries via our social media channels

  • Research, identify and approach key influencers who are in line with our brand identity

  • Help establish brand partnerships

  • Find new creative opportunities to grow our channels even more

  • Plan, write and source imagery for daily content

  • Roll up your sleeves and get hands-on with various other types of content, such as articles, infographics, case studies, newsletters and other marketing materials

  • Support the team with other content and marketing tasks, such as brand and marketing, community management, Online Travel Agencies and more

Requirements:

  • Enrolled final year student in Communications, Marketing or similar relevant education

  • Experience with design software including Canva and/or Adobe

  • Excellent written and grammatical skills in English. Knowledge of other European languages would be muy bueno / wünderbar / lekker

  • Strategic, creative and conceptual mindset

  • A genuine hunger for development, keen to chase after opportunities when you identify a chance to make an impact and get involved

  • A creative and analytical mind that knows how to make things happen and seize content opportunities when they come your way

  • Good communication skills, a flair for storytelling, and knowledge of how to target specific audiences

 

What we’re offering

  • An empowered role with real responsibilities

  • A platform to showcase your strategic thinking and creative output

  • The opportunity to play a part in shaping our content and audience engagement strategy

  • A flexible working environment as a work-from-anywhere company

  • A warm company culture - we are inclusive, social, and happy to help you grow

  • An excellent learning environment - you will get first-hand experience of the role and we’ll guide you through your journey

  • A potential full-time role depending on your performance after your internship

 

Does this sound like the challenge you’re looking for?

Apply by clicking the apply button, fill in the online form, attach your CV and make a short (selfie) video to explain why you are the best hire for this role. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at careers@joinsmiler.com.

 

Here’s what happens after you send your application:

You’ll receive an email confirmation confirming our hiring department has received your application. And an update will follow as to what the next stage of this adventure will be for you

More information on our website www.joinsmiler.com

 

About Smiler:

We believe that valuable memories deserve to be captured in high quality. It’s our mission to achieve that on a global scale for everyone. We are the world’s first on-the-spot photography marketplace that brings photographers and consumers together at tourist hotspots and other leisure locations. Globally, we are one of the most ambitious and fastest-growing startups to achieve international scale at lightning speed. We are already live on 3 continents, 70 countries, and over 670 cities, and we need your help to expand further!

results.title: Marketing Technology Manager
results.description:
Description



About Teamwork:

Teamwork's mission is to make teams who deliver client work become efficient, organized, profitable and happy! Our platform has revolutionized how companies manage their daily workflows for improved automation, productivity, and profitability. It acts as the ‘one-stop-shop’ practice management solution enabling our customers to track, manage, and invoice their projects. Our relentless customer-focus has been rewarded with thousands of amazing customers all across the globe and millions of users who sign in every day. We pride ourselves on creating market leading software, working with outstanding people, and going above and beyond for our customers. Trusted by more than 20,000 teams across 170 countries, Teamwork is in acceleration mode as we set our sights to become the undisputed Project Management platform for teams who deliver client work.

We believe in hiring great people and look to ensure everyone has the best possible experience of work, everyday. We strive to be open and transparent, humble and customer focused. And we thrive on curiosity, getting results and working together relentlessly to deliver excellence. We are a company of action, full of triers and doers: we try things, we make mistakes, and we learn from them. Our personality is unmistakable: we work hard, take joy in our wins and each other's successes and important life events. And we care and support each other when life throws lemons. More than anything we embrace a straightforward approach to getting things done. We are fanatical about our customers: and when talent meets passion, success happens.

 



The opportunity:

We are looking for an experienced Marketing Technology Manager to join our growing Marketing Team. As the Marketing Technology Manager, you will be responsible for the flawless administration of our marketing technology stack. You will act as the team’s marketing technology and automation expert, ensuring the optimal selection, configuration and adoption of fit-for-purpose marketing technologies to meet the various marketing teams’ needs. You will  also collaborate across the entire team to improve operational and campaign effectiveness. This is a hands-on role that allows you to pivot between delivery and marketing technology management and governance.  This role will collaborate with internal stakeholder as well as vendors. 

 

Some of the key responsibilities of the role are: 

 

  • Own the marketing tech stack, making recommendations for improvements and optimizations
  • Own the administration of our marketing technology stack (Hubspot, Storyblok, GA4 & Optimize, Intercom, Hotjar, and more), including assets, governance and serve as the main support contact
  • Audit our current marketing automation set up and make recommendations for improvement
  • Drive adoption of our marketing tech stack across the marketing team ensuring best practices for adoption and usage
  • Implement and maintain marketing attribution tracking, lead scoring, and lead routing in partnership with Marketing stakeholders
  • Own operational projects such as database cleanups, email template revamps, and workflows 
  • Create database queries to build lists and segments
  • Partner with the Lifecycle marketing team to optimize our email programs
  • Partner with our internal IT team to ensure the marketing automation tool and tech stack are integrated correctly with other internal systems
  • Partner with Marketing Analytics to build and maintain global reports and dashboards and support revenue attribution 
  • Partner with the Rev Ops team, marketing stakeholders, and other teams to evaluate, select and implement new marketing technologies 
  • Manage own backlog for agile delivery aligning with the goals driven by marketing team
  • Ensure all assets are GDPR complaint

 



What good looks like:

  • Solid experience in a marketing technology or marketing operations role
  • Prior experience implementing and updating lead scoring within a marketing automation system
  • Deep experience with Hubspot, or other similar systems
  • Experience with marketing tools such as GA4 & Google Optimize, ZoomInfo, Storyblok, Intercom, Hotjar and more
  • Strong understanding of emerging marketing technologies as they pertain to B2B SaaS subscription businesses
  • Familiarity with SaaS marketing concepts, terminology, and approaches is a big plus
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to present complex information in understandable way to all levels of the organisation
  • Be able to quickly establish rapport, credibility, trust, and respect throughout the organisation at all levels
  • Skilled project manager, with ability to able to successfully manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, ambiguous start-up environment while working independently with little direction or direct supervision
  • Proven ability to collaborate across marketing, sales, product and other functional teams to drive towards a common goal

 



What you can expect:

We are a remote-friendly team, with the option to work out of our Cork HQ campus, Belfast or Boston hubs - or fully remotely. At Teamwork we believe that work is what you do, not where you sit.

You will experience a collaborative and flat culture, where titles are less valued than delivering outcomes that impact and move the dial. We want you to have what you need to hit the ground running, so you will get the best kit to help you do your best work from Day 1. Our onboarding program will give you the opportunity to meet Teamworkers, learn about our market leading product and get under the hood of our Grow and Scale strategy.  

We expect our people to work hard, level up and turn up every day focused on being their best for each other and our customers. In return, you can expect to know what success looks like in your role, and have regular check-ins with your manager. In addition we will work with you to grow your career with Teamwork.

But when all is said and done we want you to have fun and enjoy working with us! We put a lot of effort into having regular social events, a weekly all staff catch up with quizzes and prizes to be won, and an annual staff gathering Grand Council focused on celebrating the wins, planning for success and building connection & collaboration. Strengths that have made us what we are today! But take some time and read more about our story and our values here

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you



Core Benefits and Perks:

  • Employee Share Options (ESOP)- we mean what we say when we say, ‘act like an owner’!
  • Competitive salary & OTE
  • 30 days vacation
  • Pension - matching 5% PRSA
  • Health plans and wellbeing programs
  • Give Back program
  • Ministry of Happiness social club
  • Educational resources and generous allowance to support development
  • Inclusive policies - maternity, paternity & parent leave, as well as a focus on flexible working
  • Recognition programs

 

Teamwork is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, family status, disability, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality or ethnic origin

 

Requirements

None

results.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About us

Qualio is on a mission to empower life science teams to launch and scale life-saving products. We’re doing that by building a connected and integrated quality management platform for the entire life science ecosystem. Qualio is trusted by 100s of highly regulated international customers, ranging from the bleeding edge of computational biology and machine learning to household names in mRNA vaccine development. 

The Qualio team is an all-remote, globally distributed workforce with teammates in over ten countries.

What’s the opportunity? 

Make a significant impact in a company helping improve lives by enabling teams to launch and scale quality health sciences products. The mission of product marketing is to learn from customers, the market, partners, the sales team, customer success teams, and the rest of Qualio and then build out and refine the positioning, messaging and content that educates partners, prospects and customers on how Qualio meets their needs. You will work closely with the sales, customer success, product and partners to understand what content helps drive acceleration along the customer journey. 

Join Qualio and help companies discover a better way to manage the quality of their products.

What will I be doing? 
  • Craft and own the communication around the business value proposition, working with internal and external stakeholders as well as technical and non-technical audiences
  • Develop and coordinate marketing strategies
  • Strong collaboration with Product, Sales, Customer Success and other Marketing teams
  • Publicly launch new products and features to our partners and channels delivering messaging that communicates the product’s value 
  • Develop partner and market-facing assets including collateral, data sheets, white papers, videos, presentations and selling tools across a wide range of quality and regulatory topics
  • Work closely with demand generation to create amazing prospects experiences and customer journeys
  • Bring customer stories to life through content that will resonate with our target audience
  • Speak or present at industry events or webinars when needed
  • Monitors markets for emerging trends to identify opportunities/challenges
  • Support sales by driving competitive intelligence
  • Build an engaged community/following to establish Qualio as a thought leader and influencer in quality management for life sciences
What skills do I need? 
  • Strong product marketing experience in a B2B software environment
  • Strong ability to influence and work cross-functionally 
  • Excellent writer and storyteller - ability to articulate, in written and spoken forms internally and externally, the long-term vision and also help sales and marketing communicate value of Qualio
  • Product and market expertise - Prior experience in a related field is a bonus, but you’ll need to demonstrate the ability to learn and grow
  • Ability to manage complex, cross-functional projects
  • Strong analytical aptitude to analyze customer data in order to find commonalities, trends, and stories that can be used in marketing and to make strategy decisions
  • Able to perform under pressure, prioritize and deliver results in a demanding and fast-paced environment that requires fresh thinking and innovation
  • A demonstrated history of being a team player, and desire to jump in and get your hands dirty as needed.
Benefits 

In addition to playing an important role in building Qualio, you'll receive:

  • Competitive salary
  • Matching 401k
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
  • Unlimited PTO (minimum of 15 days/year)
  • Professional development budget
  • Co-working space allowance or home office budget
  • Company retreats 
  • 12-weeks fully paid parental leave
  • Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products to get to market
A note to candidates:

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. That candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background, and that’s okay. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described.

#LI-Remote #Qualio_NA #Qualio_ET #Qualio_CT

results.title: Field Marketing Manager
results.description:
Acquia is the open digital experience company. We provide the world's most ambitious brands with products built around Drupal to allow them to embrace innovation and create customer moments that matter. At Acquia, we believe in the power of community and collaboration — giving our customers and partners the freedom to build tomorrow on their terms.

Headquartered in the U.S., we have been named one of North America’s fastest growing software companies by Deloitte and Inc. Magazine, rated a leader by the analyst community, and named one of the Best Places to Work by the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future and we want you to be a part of it!

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Field Marketing Manager to support our sales team in North America. As a Field Marketing Manager, you will be part of an entrepreneurial team in a rapidly growing business with your role in marketing focused on driving enterprise pipeline growth. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, development of field marketing strategies and plans, event management and execution, partner co-marketing, pipeline acceleration initiatives, and adaptation of lead generation campaigns targeted at the Enterprise and Mid-Market size businesses and the Public Sector.. 

The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with the ability to produce high-quality results. Proficiency in effective cross-functional communication coupled with a results-oriented mindset is key. Candidate must also be flexible and have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and able to handle multiple projects with tight deadlines. A strong B2B marketing background in IT with a focus on measurement and accountability are key success factors.

Job Requirements:
  • Craft overall marketing strategy in collaboration with Sales leaders and Marketing to deliver leads and accelerate pipeline growth targeted on new logo creation.
  • Drive new and creative lead generation activities including events (virtual/hybrid/in-person), direct marketing, webinars, collateral and customer case studies.
  • Develop account based marketing plans leveraging market and customer data and analytics to identify who to target, where and how.
  • Collaborate closely with the channel team to integrate partners into field marketing opportunities.
  • Track and analyze the efficiency of our marketing campaigns to determine ROI and prioritize resources.
  • Lead all aspects of budget, metrics and marketing spend ROI.

Desired Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 5 years experience in a digitally-led B2B marketing role.
  • Experience of developing marketing programs for enterprise targets.
  • Ability to demonstrate marketing impact on bookings via account based marketing plans.
  • Prior experience in high technology/enterprise software in a field marketing role is required.
  • Ability to craft great collateral and structure and write compelling marketing copy for campaigns.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to earn trust and respect from sales management.
  • Experience with sales operations, reporting, marketing & campaign dashboards and KPIs.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders in a fast moving environment.
  • Willingness to travel.

Acquia is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We hire without regard to age, color, disability, gender (including gender identity), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Interested residents of Colorado may contact NA-recruiting@acquia.com as it relates to regulation C.R.S. § 8-5-201. Information regarding benefits are linked here.

results.title: Content Creator, Privacy Not Included
results.description:
The Mozilla Foundation’s award-winning *Privacy Not Included project (PNI) is seeking an individual to support the creation of consumer-facing, web-based content to help consumers understand the privacy + security of their technology.

As a result of your work, people who use, but don’t always understand the privacy and security of technology, will feel empowered to buy products that align with their values. Your content will appear in a variety of online mediums (news articles, research publications, emails, blogs, social media and original long-form content) and reach millions of people. We are not seeking a writer with only technological know-how; instead, our ideal candidate would excel at storytelling and writing engaging content that is informative but also humorous, accessible, and easy-to-read.

Working with the *PNI Lead and Researcher, the Content Creator will be responsible for:

  • Writing, editing and fact checking *Privacy Not Included product reviews and publications; see privacynotincluded.org
  • Drafting original content in various formats that cover topics related to the *Privacy Not Included project and advised through research + interviews
  • Developing content that tells a story with a consistent and cohesive voice, and is aligned with the Mozilla and Privacy Not Included brand
  • Maintaining an editorial calendar for *Privacy Not Included content that feeds into the broader Mozilla Foundation editorial calendar
  • Creating and maintaining a system of cataloging *Privacy Not Included content to ensure timely updating and sharing of content as relevant
  • Collaborating with Marketing team colleagues to identify and leverage audience and SEO insights into content ideas
  • Collaborating with Marketing team colleagues to develop *Privacy Not Included content graphics and publication timelines for news articles, social media posts, blog posts, and other long-form content
Required Qualifications
  • 4 years experience writing and creating consumer-facing web content
  • 2+ years’ experience as an effective web-based content creator with a digital storytelling approach.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail.
  • Proven ability to present complex information in a clear and concise way.
  • Proven track record to quickly learn and understand complex topics.
  • A basic understanding of technology, including privacy/security principles and their potential impact on people/communities
  • Proven track record as a strong collaborator and communicator with colleagues across different departments.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and to work independently.
  • Experience working in a distributed organization, preferably a remote-first workplace.
  • Alignment with Mozilla mission and *Privacy Not Included project goals
Salary and Benefits Information:

The Mozilla Foundation is dedicated to fair and equitable compensation for our staff. We strive to pay a competitive and market-based salary that takes into consideration the responsibilities and requirements of the role. We strive to offer at the midpoint of our salary ranges for the purposes of increasing inclusivity and fairness of our offer process and ensuring internal equity. We do not ask for, or take into account, salary histories in our offer process.

The base salary ranges, along with mid-point, for this role in each of the key countries in which we employ staff is listed below. We target the 75th percentile of market pay as a salary band midpoint for all levels, with 10% either side of the midpoint to create a salary range.

  • Germany: €69,039 - €84,381 (mid-point: €76,710)
  • UK: £40,939 - £50,037 (mid-point: £45,488)
  • Canada: $78,160 - $95,528 (mid-point: $86,844)
  • US: $73,271 - $89,553 (mid-point: $81,412)

Depending on the successful candidate’s location, we may also add in a geographic differential to this base salary that accounts for local job market weighting. This differential is applied to the above ranges depending on the successful candidate’s location. Below are some of the common cities in which we hire staff along with representative examples of salary ranges, along with mid-point, with the geographical differential applied:

  • Inner London: £44,623 - £54,540 (mid-point: £49,581)
  • Toronto: $84,334 - $103,075 (mid-point: $93,704)
  • New York: $93,412 - $114,171 (mid-point: $103,791)

The range for your specific location will be discussed in screening conversations if your application is successful.

We offer the following benefits:
  • Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance + Accidental Death & Dismemberment
  • Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Retirement Plan contributions
  • 20 Paid Time Off days per year (prorated) + your birthday
  • Company Holidays + Shutdown
  • Wellness budget
  • Professional Development budget
  • Top up program for Parental leaves

Benefits are subject to change at any time at the discretion of Mozilla Foundation.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation at accommodation@mozillafoundation.org.

results.title: Product Marketing Director, GovCon ERP
results.description:
The Product Marketing Director will define and enable Unanet’s Go-To-Market Strategy for our ERP solution for Government Contractors (GovCon) and work with our Director of CRM on aligning our CRM story, message and integration between ERP and CRM for GovCon. This is an outstanding opportunity to develop marketing-problem-oriented messaging, positioning and to be the public voice of our ERP solution to internal and external audiences.

What You’ll Do

  • Be the clear and enthusiastic voice of the customer and market for the GovCon market
  • Lead and excite cross functional groups, in particular sales, about the market opportunity and how we uniquely solve it
  • Create a solution-based story that you use to enable sales, the company, and the market
  • Understand and continuously develop understanding of Unanet’s portfolio of products; translate technical features into messages that resonate with the broader market
  • Present at company and industry events as a thought leader and a product expert
  • Create and execute Go-to-Market (GTM) strategy and plans
  • Define buyer personas, needs and map to the buyer journey
  • Develop differentiated, value-based messaging in the language of the buyer for a variety of communication channels
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in the planning and execution of successful product launches
  • Assist in the development and delivery of sales enablement materials, including but not limited to presentations, playbooks, and scripts
  • Understand the competitive landscape and develop competitive intelligence tools to support sales and marketing programs
  • Collaborate closely with Product Management to influence the product roadmap, understand product updates, do competitive analysis, and enable sales
  • Create a content strategy and work with the extended marketing team on executing key thought leadership and content for example, eBooks, webinars, and presentations at events
  • Track and analyze the effectiveness of product marketing activities through the measurement of key metrics
  • Collaborate with other product marketing managers on the team to create vertical based stories to bring to market
  • Hone product marketing skills to be an example of industry excellence

First 90 days

  • In your first 30 days, you will become familiar with our customers, products, the industries we serve, and our approach to marketing, sales, and customer success. You will immerse yourself in product education, working closely with colleagues to learn about our people and the processes that make Unanet run.
  • In your first 60 days, you will establish relationships, trust and rapport with the product marketing team, product management and sales, as well as others across our company. You will manage the launches with product management and prepare enablement sessions for company readiness.
  • In your first 90 days, you have a strong understanding of our market and product offerings. You are able to speak and write credibly about our solutions with customers and prospects. You will have established yourself as the go-to person, leader and problem solver on all things GovCon ERP product marketing.

  Who You Are

  • 7+ years of product marketing experience in B2B software
  • Experience with Pragmatic Marketing principals
  • Proficiency with business productivity applications, preferably in the GovCon industry
  • Demonstrable analytical experience used to markedly improve customer development, product adoption, and sales process via relevant metrics (e.g., Content Effectiveness, Win Rate, Market Penetration)
  • Experience performing research and building competitive analyses, as well as presenting to a diverse Sales organization
  • Clear and succinct written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to travel to customer and/or partner sites, conferences, or other field events, as well as quarterly working sessions

Differentiators

  • MBA
  • Experience in a high-growth B2B software environment
  • Experience in the Government Contracting industries

 Our Values

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.

results.title: Senior Marketing Manager, Demand Generation
results.description:
Description

Claroty empowers the world's largest enterprises to secure their cyber-physical systems across industrial (OT), healthcare (IoMT), and enterprise (IoT) environments: the Extended Internet of Things (XIoT). The Claroty Platform integrates with customers’ existing infrastructure to provide a full range of controls for visibility, risk and vulnerability management, threat detection, and secure remote access. Our platform is deployed by hundreds of organizations at thousands of sites across all seven continents. 

Launched by the famed Team8 foundry in 2015, Claroty is headquartered in New York City, with employees across the Americas, Europe, Asia-Pacific, and Tel Aviv. Claroty has raised $635 million in funding from the world’s largest investment firms and industrial automation vendors – including SoftBank, Bessemer Venture Partners, Rockwell Automation, Schneider Electric, and Siemens – making it the most well-funded industrial cybersecurity company. 

As the Senior Demand Generation Manager, you will blend strategy with execution, owning and implementing demand gen programs and campaigns.

You will be a critical driver in our effort to achieve pipeline and revenue goals and execute campaigns against our core buyer segments to increase market awareness, generate demand, accelerate the pipeline, and grow sales.



Responsibilities:
  • Develop strategies for both acquiring and nurturing leads that drive awareness, consideration, and purchase intent across all channels including email, webinars, partners, paid programs, and virtual events
  • Partner with our sales teams and sales development managers to ensure seamless interactions for prospects
  • Own email content strategy and use data to determine what content to put in front of the right lead at the right time
  • Monitoring and reporting campaign performance with granular tracking across relevant KPIs
  • Leverage marketing automation and lead management to streamline, automate and measure all marketing tasks and workflows


Region:
North America
Requirements
  • 5+ years experience in B2B demand generation or campaign marketing with demonstrated lead, pipeline, and revenue growth, preferably in Saas
  • Deep industry knowledge of cutting-edge demand generation methods, including creating a funnel, nurturing strategies, and digital, online, and live events
  • Proven track record of acquiring customers and expanding brand presence through innovative strategies and execution
  • Analytically-driven decision maker, with the ability to capture and share key data and insights and use data to drive key marketing strategies and decisions
  • A person who looks beyond just the marketing domain to help drive analytical insights that help the company expand and target key market segments, drive pipeline velocity, and contribute to the company’s overall go-to-market strategy
  • Proficiency in systems like HubSpot or comparable marketing automation platforms, Business Intelligence Tools, and Salesforce
  • Must be organized and detail-oriented to efficiently execute and manage a variety of projects simultaneously
  • Growth mindset with the ability to develop strategy and plan, and then be hands-on executing
  • Ability to think strategically and roll up your sleeves to get things done
  • High energy with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
  • You have a track record of hitting aggressive growth goals leveraging a diverse set of channels and tactics, expert in end-to-end campaign development, execution, and measurement
  • Great at building cross-functional relationships. You've worked closely with data, sales, content, and operations partners


The expected salary of $125,000 to $150,000. This is a good faith estimate but does not include equity, bonus, commissions, or other forms of compensation. Pay will be by experience level, but those outside of the salary band are welcome to apply.

At Claroty, we are looking to hire individuals who embody our core values: People First, Customer Obsession, Striving for Excellence, and Integrity. 

Claroty is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment for all. We encourage applications from candidates of ALL diverse backgrounds, and special accommodations are available upon request in all phases of the hiring process.

results.title: Lifecycle Marketing Manager
results.description:
We're seeking a Lifecycle Marketing Manager you will develop the overall lifecycle communications strategy to nurture and increase prospect engagement across the full buyer journey. You will be focused on personalized content and program activation through the database by leveraging email, retargeting, digital advertising, intent, gifting and other relevant channels.



What You'll Do
  • Oversee, develop, and manage lifecycle marketing journeys and automated campaigns to engage and optimize conversions throughout the funnel 
  • Work with email operations and agency partners to maintain email automation methodologies such as triggers, attributes, segmentation, and list hygiene
  • Analyze all aspects of the buying  journey, leveraging insights to develop a strategic roadmap and execute campaigns with a focus on segmentation and content, web and digital personalization
  • Work closely with sales to collaborate on pipeline acceleration and win-back campaigns 
  • Consistently measure, report, and educate the leadership and cross-functional teams of campaign performance, adjusting strategy and as needed


What You'll Bring
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent experience
  • 3+ years of relevant growth, lifecycle, or marketing experience, developing multi-channel content strategies
  • Experience with CRM, Email Automation and ABM Platforms (Salesforce, Marketo, 6Sense or similar)  
  • Strategic and analytical thinker, comfortable using platforms like Google Analytics and Tableau
  • Bonus points: Marketo certified and/or experience using a corporate gifting platform 



How You Work
  • You are strategic - you can recognize key audiences and inflection points within the buying journey and can weave together a cohesive communication framework including email, in-app notifications and events
  • You are a strong communicator, can coordinate between multiple teams and stakeholders and leadership
  • You are process and data oriented and seek to drive scale, understand and replicate success and consistently re-evaluate and iterate on existing programs
  • You are creative and not afraid to have fun - we work with a really unique product that allows for lively and inspired campaigns
  • You can create compelling and personalized content and nurture programs that can be used throughout prospecting programs

  • You are a self-starter, can work independently and are looking to carve out your own career path at a fast growth company
How we work:
• We work sane, sustainable and flexible working hours.
• We offer “take what you need” PTO, and have a genuine, supportive culture around work life balance and boundaries. 
• We are consistently building, refining and automating processes to aid our work; we encourage each team member to propose and adopt new technologies, frameworks, and processes that make us more effective as an organization.
• Some of us work near or in corporate offices (pandemic permitting) but many of us work remotely full time.
• You are empowered to choose the environment that maximizes your happiness, engagement and ability to reach our shared goals.

Who We Are:
Sendoso is the leading Sending Platform that delivers modern direct mail, personalized gifts, eGifts, and other Physical Impressions™ at scale. This makes it possible to build stronger, deeper, and more trusted relationships that move everything up and to the right! We’re a Series C company with $154M in venture capital funding with more than 800+ customers and 20,000 active users. Our award-winning Sending Platform connects online and offline experiences via cloud software, automation, and real-world logistics.
Our mission is to help companies rise above the noise by eradicating spam and elevating relationships. Our goal is to enable businesses everywhere to make more human connections in a digital world.

We are unable to hire in the following states at this time: CO, HI 

Sendoso is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
By submitting your application, you agree that Sendoso may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes.

results.title: SEO Specialist
results.description:
Description

Bizzabo is seeking a technically-savvy and results-driven SEO Specialist who will be responsible for developing and implementing projects that increase the SEO performance of Bizzabo. This role will have a high degree of ownership over the SEO roadmap including prioritizing projects and the detailing needs for implementation. Responsibilities will include conducting assessments to identify opportunities, quantifying their merits, and working with product and engineering teams to implement them successfully. Bizzabo powers immersive in-person, virtual, and hybrid experiences. The Bizzabo Event Experience OS is a data-rich open platform that allows Event Experience Leaders to manage events, engage audiences, activate communities, and deliver powerful business outcomes — while keeping attendee data private and secure. Bizzabo powers the events of world-leading brands — from Fortune 100 enterprise organizations and financial institutions to creative agencies and scaling tech companies. Bizzabo was founded in 2011 by Boaz Katz, Alon Alroy, and Eran Ben-Shushan, and is headquartered in New York and Tel Aviv.



Community Details and Perks:

The Bizzabo Community

At Bizzabo we believe that culture is more than just happy hour and a ping pong table (though we do love a good ping pong tournament), we believe that culture is everything we do and how we do it. Our values are what help to guide us in our interactions with each other, our customers, and anyone who crosses paths with Bizzabo. Bizzabo fosters an environment of communication and trust. We don’t just offer the opportunity to share ideas, we encourage you to own your ideas and bring them to fruition.

 

Bizzabo is dedicated to ensuring equity in the workplace and fostering a diverse, inclusive environment where every voice is heard and everyone belongs. Qualified applicants will be considered regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, race, national origin, religious beliefs, military or veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

 

Note: All Bizzabo communications related to job postings will be conducted using corporate email. At no point will Bizzabo communicate or conduct interviews using messaging apps. Please report any suspicious communications to security@bizzabo.com

 

#LI-MP1

Requirements

What you’ll be doing:

  • Develop, manage, and evolve our SEO strategy, roadmap, and vision to meaningfully grow our audience
  • Develop and clearly articulate business cases for investment, tying outcomes to measurable KPIs including revenue and customer acquisition
  • Own responsibility for developing SEO product and technical priorities, working with our dedicated content product team to prioritize the product roadmap and balance organic growth with excellent user experience
  • Partner closely with content marketing leadership to develop and refine SEO content strategy for both new and existing content

Who you are:

  • You have a proven track record of scaling an engaged organic SEO audience beyond 1MM+ monthly visitors
  • You have deep experience across SEO disciplines, including on-page SEO, off-page SEO, technical SEO, and analytics; experience with local SEO is a plus
  • You have an entrepreneurial drive and a sense of urgency, creativity, and curiosity for how we can continue to outperform the competition in SEO
  • You’re collaborative, diplomatic, and humble, with outstanding written and verbal communication skills; you thrive working cross-functionally
  • You’re fluent with major SEO tools and platforms; our current stack includes Semrush, Yoast, and Google Search Console.

results.title: Social Media Manager
results.description:
About Magic Square

 

Magic Square is the world's first Web3 solution to simplify Crypto, conceptualizing the beauty of an App Store with a built-in DAO mechanism to create a highly secure and accessible environment of all Apps, CeDeFi, NFTs, Games, and more in one single place.

Our vision is to create a space for using crypto apps with user experience at the forefront. Our product breaks down all borders with cross-chain interoperability and streamlined interfaces.

Magic Square is backed by industry leaders such as Binance Labs, Republic Captial, Crypto.com, KuCoin Labs, Huobi Ventures, Gate.io Labs, GSR, IQ Protocol, Dao Maker, and more, and is now evaluated at $120M.


Recent Publications

TechCrunch

The Block

CoinTelegraph

Binance Blog

About our Team

 

The people behind Magic Square are first-class industry professionals, blockchain veterans, experienced software developers, and seasoned crypto enthusiasts. Our ultimate goal is to reshape the crypto app experience, bringing decentralized applications, cryptocurrencies, and Web3.0 to every business possible.

You’ll get more than just working experience at MagicSquare. You’ll join a vast network of entrepreneurs and technologists across the globe.

#PeopleFirstAlways

Diversity, equality, and inclusion play a crucial role in everything we do - from how we build our products to how we build our team.

Our company is still young but we are 100% committed to creating a workplace where all people are valued, respected, and encouraged to be themselves.

We actively honor people's diverse abilities, sexual orientations, ethnicities, faiths, and genders, and everyone is welcomed and supported in their development at all stages of their own journey with us.

We fundamentally believe diversity brings greater success. Regardless of visible or invisible differences, we foster a culture where everyone has an equal opportunity to reach their full potential and to be heard and valued. And yes, we may not always get everything right along the way and there is still work to do, but we are willing to listen,
share, learn, and do it better together. 

About the Role:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Social Media Manager to join our team at Magic Square. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in managing social media channels for crypto or Web3 projects, as well as a passion for staying up-to-date on the latest trends in the industry.

In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing a social media strategy that supports the overall marketing and communication goals of the company. This will include creating engaging content for social media platforms, monitoring and responding to comments and messages, and analyzing metrics to identify areas for improvement.

To be successful in this role, you should have a strong understanding of how to effectively use social media platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram to reach target audiences. You should also have excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as the ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.

If you are a self-starter with a proven track record of success in social media management for crypto or Web3 projects, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please include a cover letter and resume highlighting your relevant experience and skills.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute a social media strategy that aligns with the overall marketing and communication goals of the company.
  • Create and publish engaging content for social media platforms, including text, images, and video.
  • Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and reviews on social media channels.
  • Collaborate with marketing, customer service, and other teams to ensure consistent messaging across all channels.
  • Analyze social media metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimize the social media strategy as needed.
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest social media trends and best practices, and identify opportunities to incorporate them into the social media strategy.
  • Create and manage social media campaigns, including the development of targeting, budget, and creative assets.
  • Manage and maintain a content calendar for social media channels.
  • Collaborate with influencers and industry partners to amplify reach and engagement.
  • Monitor and report on the performance of social media campaigns and initiatives.

The ideal candidate - who you are and requirements:

  • A bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field.
  • 2-3 years of experience in social media management, preferably for a brand or organization in the crypto or Web3 space.
  • Fluent English Speaker. 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create engaging content for a variety of social media platforms.
  • Proficiency in other languages is a plus.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to use data to inform decision-making.
  • Proficiency with social media management tools such as Zoho Social.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects concurrently.
  • Knowledge of the latest social media trends and best practices.
  • Experience with content creation tools such as Figma.
  • Familiarity with image and video editing software is a plus.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Sounds like a challenge you'd like to take on? Then apply now!

Benefits:

True to the motto "Take care of your employees, and they'll take care of your business", you'll find a lot of good things in working with us. For example:

  • Work remotely from anywhere in the world
  • Company events and celebrations
  • A fast-paced, challenging, and one-of-a-kind business sector
  • Flat company and international work environment
  • Excellent opportunities for advancement in a growing organization
  • Possibility of international transfers and relocation mid-career
  • Competitive payment and compensation in the form of Tokens - you grow with the company
  • At Magic Square, you’ll be empowered to work on things that you’re passionate about. You’ll be given autonomy. Your ideas matter!

If you're still hesitating because you don't think you're a 100% fit for the job, THEN APPLY ANYWAYS and we'll have a chat! Maybe you've got more potential than you think ;)

We are looking forward to connecting with you!

results.title: Junior Digital Marketing Specialist
results.description:
As the PPC specialist for PBSCO, this role will own a significant marketing budget and one of the biggest revenue sources for the company. Money. Power. Mwahaha.

It’s a fun role, so let’s get serious. Photobooth Supply Co is in the business of empowering entrepreneurs and business owners, adding more fun and creativity to events, and delivering memories and joy to any festive event. Your job, basically, is to add more fun to the world, seriously.

You will love this job if you find yourself immersed in the flow of researching keywords, writing ad creative, making small tweaks with big changes, and the satisfaction of watching the numbers climb up and to the right.

This position reports to the Director of Marketing, and has the support of other senior marketers and designers for ad creatives.

Day-to-day performance involves managing a six-figure adspend, optimizing ads, split testing ads, testing various creatives, research keywords, identifying relevant audiences, and improving the reach and performance of all paid platforms. You are a ninja, and you are here to ninja our paid ads to peak performance.

For top performers, this position provides the opportunity for significant upward trajectory.

  • Own and operate TikTok ads, creating a campaign from the ground up and working closely with our social media team and sales teams to ensure seasonal relevance and alignment with campaigns.

Requirements

  • Google Ads experience, including ad copy

results.title: Paid Search Specialist
results.description:

results.title: Director of Growth
results.description:
About Ceremonia:

Ceremonia is a fast growing, venture funded clean hair care brand rooted in Latinx heritage. We are on a mission to empower a wellness approach to hair, manifesting modern day rituals stemming from rich culture that feed your hair from the roots and beyond. The company is founded and led by award-winning business professional and fellow Latina Babba Rivera and supported by top tier DTC, beauty, e-commerce and tech investors.

Role overview:

Ceremonia is seeking an analytical and entrepreneurial leader to define and execute Ceremonia’s growth strategy. In this capacity, you will own the roadmap to accelerate Ceremonia’s already rapid growth (on track to 3x+ two years in a row) - building growth loops, validating and scaling new acquisition/retention tactics, owning channel-by-channel ROI analysis (CAC, LTV, AOV), and delivering a luxury user experience to Ceremonia’s existing customer base. We’re committed to investing in scale - as you unlock new growth levers, your team and budget will expand.

As Director of Growth Marketing, you’ll define the roadmap and vision for how more people establish their own modern day rituals with Ceremonia. You are a curious and analytical self-starter, with a demonstrable track record of experience in paid and organic acquisition (Facebook, Instagram, Google Shopping, SEO), retention (CRM, referral, loyalty programs), and segmentation/personalization. You’re excited to test the newest channels for growing an audience (SMS, TikTok, video testimonials), and know the data needed to either disqualify or further invest in a channel.

We’re the first Latinx clean hair brand to be featured in Sephora (with a nationwide rollout around the corner), and are a diverse, creative team looking for someone who shares our values. We offer competitive compensation and benefits as well as equity.

 

Reports to: C-Suite

 

Responsibilities:

  • Define and own the growth marketing roadmap, including:

  • Testing and scaling paid and organic channels for acquisition and retention

  • Reporting revenue analytics at top level & across campaigns and channels (CAC, LTV, RFM model)

  • Define customer lifecycle journeys; owning strategy, building triggered/event-based and one-off email sequences, and testing new touchpoints (e.g. SMS)

  • Lead concept to completion launches for buyer retention and reactivation, such as referral, shopper loyalty, discounts/incentives

  • Own segmentation and personalization, customizing shopper experience to where they are in their Ceremonia journey

  • Forecasting sales performance and define annual targets

  • Owning paid marketing spend – as you prove ROI, your budget will scale

  • As channels scale, build and manage a team

  • Manage customer segmentation strategy and develop smart attribution modeling, ensuring we reach the right audience with the right message, at the right place and time

 

Requirements:

  • Demonstrable experience in designing and implementing successful paid marketing campaigns

  • Hands on experience with SEO/SEM, Facebook, Google Analytics, lifecycle marketing, and CRM software

  • Excellent analytical and project management skills with strong detail orientation

  • Strong team management and communication skills

  • Experience managing large yearly budgets, while still maintaining a scrappy startup mentality

  • 5+ years of experience in fast-moving, direct-to-consumer environments or performance marketing agencies focusing on growth and acquisition marketing

 

Nice to have:

  • Familiarity with Shopify

  • Proficiency in SQL

 

Ceremonia Benefits (for U.S. Based Employees)

  • Competitive comp package (base + bonus + stock options)

  • Health insurance (medical, vision & dental)

  • 20 days PTO

results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About NeuraFlash:

We are a leading AI and Consulting Partner of Amazon & Salesforce obsessed with helping our customers transform their contact centers with AI Powered Experiences. Our expertise spans across the Amazon ecosystem with Amazon Connect, Lex & Contact Lens and Salesforce ecosystem with Service Cloud Voice, Einstein Bots and Digital Channels, Service Cloud, Field Service, CPQ, MuleSoft, and Einstein Analytics. We are experts in building experiences grounded in data that transform and optimize the employee and customer journey.

What sets NeuraFlash apart?

At NeuraFlash, our people form the core of our business and the soul of our brand. We hire individuals who inspire us and look at challenges as opportunities to create innovative solutions. You’ll be provided with ongoing education and development opportunities via our Salesforce Partnership Program and mentorship programs created for our aspiring leaders. NeuraFlash is on the forefront of cutting-edge technologies and we understand by investing in you, we’re investing in ourselves!

As the first Product Marketing Manager at NeuraFlash, you will drive go-to-market initiatives for NeuraFlash’s growing suite of Salesforce AppExchange and Amazon Marketplace products and packages. Utilizing a wide range of marketing techniques in tight collaboration with our VP of Marketing, you will create messaging that drives the opportunity pipeline and promotes our products to existing and potential customers across several industries. In addition, this person will need to stay close with the sales organization and product leadership from our partners, to always have a forward-thinking roadmap in future releases and products to take advantage of the market opportunities and create continuous differentiation for NeuraFlash. 

The Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for product launches, GTM strategy, value propositions, videos, demos, customer renewals, awareness, and more. 

AS PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER, YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO: 

  • Develop go-to-market strategy for new and existing products 
  • Ensure our existing and new customers renew their license agreements, take advantage of new features, and add-on additional products from NeuraFlash
  • Train Sales team members on product features 
  • Educate and create high awareness of the broader Salesforce, Amazon, and other markets
  • Continue to create differentiation for our products and the NeuraFlash brand
  • Stay close to the sales, CSG, and delivery teams as well as our technology partners
  • Present to executives and stakeholders on product launches and value propositions 
  • Understand customers’ needs and challenges and create targeted campaigns and launches
  • Partner with sales, product, and other cross functional teams to drive alignment on new releases 
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Driven leader that is excited about the product opportunities with Salesforce/Amazon and others
  • 5+ years of product marketing or product GTM strategy experience
  • Background in Product Marketing or related field within the Salesforce and/or Amazon AWS CRM space
  • Strong ability to identify and utilize customer needs to tell an inspiring story about our product solution 
  • Confident presentation and training skills in front of all organizational levels 
  • Hands-on experience and willingness to create content strategies and lead their execution
  • Provide leadership and mentorship to the internal NeuraFlash product teams
  • Collaborates well with all of the NeuraFlash key stakeholders across Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Managed Services, and Delivery
  • Build strong relationships with product leadership at Salesforce and Amazon
What’s it like to be a part of NeuraFlash?
  • Remote & In-Person: Whether you work out of our HQ in Massachusetts, one of our regional hubs, our India office, or you're one of over half of our NeuraFlash Family who work remotely, we’re focused on keeping everyone connected and unified as one team.
  • Flexibility: Do you have to take the dog to the vet, pick up the kids from school, or the in-laws from the airport? We know that a perfect 9-5 isn’t possible. So you have to jump out to do any of those, no problem! We build a culture of trust and understanding. We value good work not the hours in which you get it done
  • Collaboration: You have a voice here!  If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it’s a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving.  Our executive team holds town halls & company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.
  • Celebrate Often: We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Whether it is an arm wrestling contest, costume party, or ugly holiday sweaters our teams love to have fun. And while we work hard, we don’t forget to slow down and celebrate the big things and the small things together.
The “Flashy” Perks:
  • Be in the right space: Work at the forefront of AI & Innovation on the Salesforce Platform.
  • Growth: In 2021, we grew our team by close to 90%, and we plan to do the same again this year!  There’s no limit to where your career at NeuraFlash can go.
     
  • L&D Program: We are invested in your success. This program was built to help our employees advance in their career in Salesforce and at NeuraFlash.
  • Mentorship Program: Each new team member is assigned a mentor to help them acclimate at NeuraFlash.
  • Monthly & Weekly Socials: We hold monthly & weekly virtual socials to have more opportunities to be together.
  • Company Retreats: This looks a little different in the age of COVID-19 but we gather the entire company twice a year to share stories & visions for NeuraFlash.  

Location: NeuraFlash strives to provide you with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for your lifestyle. For those that prefer an office setting, this role may be based in any of our hub locations within the United States, India, and British Columbia, Canada. If you prefer to work from your home, we can accommodate remote locations anywhere in the United States for our U.S. based employees, and anywhere within British Columbia for our Canadian employees !

results.title: SEO and Content Marketing Expert Writer

results.title: Digital marketing Manager - UK

Description

At Lumenis, our commitment to excellence and innovation is driven by the energy of more than 1,000 professionals worldwide. This is what allows us to deliver groundbreaking innovations in the ophthalmology and aesthetic fields and to be recognized as the undisputed world leader in energy-based medical devices. 

Headquartered in Israel, we are a truly innovative and international organization with a solid global footprint in developed as well as emerging markets, such as the United States, Germany, Italy, United Kingdom, China & Hong Kong, Japan, India, Australia, Korea, Singapore, and Taiwan. 

 

DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER

 

As a Digital Marketing Manager for our Aesthetic Division you will be responsible to update and manager all the digital platform Lumenis is currently using. You will be also responsible for introducing new digital marketing strategies within the organization.

 

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute B2B and B2C Digital Marketing campaigns;
  • Champion paid ads execution and reporting (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Youtube, Google);
  • Establish our web presence to boost brand awareness;
  • Analyze and understand our current status, envision the expectation and find a way to reach them;
  • Champion the email marketing and optimize communications with a focus on engagement and on customer journey;
  • Focus on lead generation and brand awareness, building and developing opportunities for business through the Lumenis digital space;
  • Keep pace with industry trends and developments related to the digital landscape and discover new ways to expand brand reach in other emerging platforms.

 

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as a digital marketing manager both in B2B and B2C;
  • Proven success in managing Social Media platforms and strong digital skills;
  • Good knowledge of Salesforce;
  • Fluent in English, any other European languages are a plus;
  • Able to progress projects individually and as part of a remote team; ability to work independently;
  • Able to respond to evolving business priorities and needs, in a fast-paced environment;
  • Experience in the medical or aesthetic/beauty industry is of advantage.

 

The position is based remotely. Preferable locations would be France, Germany, Italy or UK.

Requirements

None

results.title: Sr. Director, Demand Generation
results.description:
Company Description

Jitterbit is a market-leading Enterprise Integration Platform as a Service (eiPaaS) & API Management (API-M) solution provider, headquartered in Alameda, CA - recently recognized by Gartner as a Leader in the Magic Quadrant for the 6th Year in a row!

Jitterbit helps businesses make faster, more effective decisions by enabling them to unify and exploit data from all sources. 

Using the Jitterbit API integration platform companies can rapidly connect SaaS, on-premises and cloud applications and instantly infuse artificial intelligence into any business process. Our intuitive API creation technology enables companies to reuse business-critical applications and data to bring new offerings to market in days, not months.



Job Description

Jitterbit is seeking a highly motivated, analytical, passionate and tech savvy Sr. Director of
Demand Generation. Reporting directly to our CMO, you will own Jitterbit’s demand
generation plans to drive rapid growth in the enterprise and mid-market. You will have
leadership responsibility for the planning, organizing, executing, and measurement of
integrated marketing programs and campaigns that result in substantial new sales
opportunity creation.


You will work closely with and leverage the knowledge of Sales, Product Marketing, and
Product Management to develop a plan to generate leads, opportunities and grow pipeline
and bookings/ACV for our sales team.


The candidate must be creative, analytical and hands-on with a strong bias to action, and
have the ability to meet deadlines and work collaboratively in a fast-paced, loosely
structured, highly dynamic environment.

Responsibilities

● Create annual and quarterly marketing plans to include thought leadership initiatives

and demand generation programs for lead creation, lead nurturing, and customer

marketing with clear objectives and outcomes defined.

● Collaborate closely with sales management, field marketing, and sales executives to

develop the strategies, processes, and content required to execute best-in-class

campaigns and programs which result in substantial pipeline growth.

● Lead a lean and agile team of demand generation marketers and scale as we

continue to grow our business.

● Utilize a portfolio of marketing strategies to develop, test, launch, and measure

programs: account-based marketing programs, emails, events, webinars, content

syndication, digital ads, and 3rd party programs.

● Proactively engage with the direct and indirect sales teams to coordinate,

communicate, and optimize the impact of marketing activities.

● Effectively communicate plans and metrics regularly.

● Possess a long-term view for growth strategies with short term, paced execution.



Qualifications

● 8+ years of marketing experience and with a focus in B2B software required.

● Proven and successful inbound and account-based demand generation program

creation, execution, measurement, analysis, and reporting across channels

● Proven analytical and data-driven approach to demand generation.

● Top notch quantitative skills are essential. Gets excited by extracting actionable

learnings from campaign data, managing pipeline spreadsheets and identifying

insights from numbers to continuously improve execution.

● Proven results and practical know-how of the latest trends and tactics in digital

marketing.

● Advanced knowledge of current and innovative B2B demand generation methods

across multiple channels (email, webinars, SEM/SEO, display, social, events, etc.)

● Experience with Salesforce, Marketo, Google Analytics, AdWords and other

marketing automation tools.

● Highly collaborative, self-starter who is always interested in learning and innovating.

Unafraid to take action and comfortable working in a fast-paced dynamic

environment

● Positive, energetic attitude, and initiative with a strong work ethic.

● Able to work comfortably in a hands-on, deadline-driven environment.

● Experience in managing fast-growth teams and proven natural leadership skills.

● Creative thinker, strategic thinker, problem solver.



Additional Information

What You’ll Get:

  • Work for a growing leader within the Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) tech space
  • Join a mission-driven company that is transforming the industry by changing the way customers use API creation within business-critical processes.
  • Career development and mentorship
  • A flexible, remote-friendly company with personality and heart

results.title: Grants Partnership Manager
results.description:
Who we are

WeSchool is the leading Italian EdTech Company. We are on a mission to ensure learning never stops: our goal is to empower educators and students of any age and encourage them to innovate learning by making it more inclusive, collaborative, and engaging. We are currently a team of over 60 people located worldwide.

What's in it for you

In your role, you will help us forge new strategic partnerships with high-level organisations in Europe that will join WeSchool in responding to calls for proposals, calls for tenders and other funding opportunities. You will be part of WeSchool's Sales Area and will contribute to achieving business goals and executing the Grants&Tenders strategy. 

You will 

  • Liaise with key stakeholders, providing evidence and advice on key partnership opportunities
  • Develop and pro-actively drive relationships with European partners to jointly respond to calls for proposals, call for tenders and other funding opportunities 
  • Design strategies for each partnership to ensure long-lasting relationships
  • Provide current analysis, insight and intelligence on the partnership portfolio deploying it efficiently to drive the full potential of our relations
  • Work closely with the Education Area to qualify and onboard the right organisations to partner with in joint proposals

About you

Required Qualifications

  • Strong existing external network/working relationships with key staff within institutional partners in European and national contexts
  • Proven experience of accomplishment in partnership building, brokering relationships with partners and engagement
  • Excellent relationship-building skills with the ability to network with, and influence, senior people both internally and externally to achieve a pre-defined 
  • outcome
  • Excellent ability to communicate clearly to both internal and external audiences
  • Strategic planning skills, in relation to positioning with donors, and in prioritising engagement focus
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills in English (C1) 
  • High interest in education and digital (EdTech).

Preferred Qualifications

  • Previous experience in consulting on European grants and funding schemes  
  • Previous experience in the EdTech, Education or Digital sectors
  • Being fluent in French and/or German is a plus

What we offer

  • Contractor or Employee contract (we are open to both)
  • Competitive salary
  • +30 days of paid leave
  • Full Remote or Hybrid work model
  • A learning environment where you can build upon your skills and interests
  • Flat hierarchy where your voice is heard, your views are welcomed and appreciated across all levels in the organization
  • A diverse, inclusive, and multicultural working environment

About Us

We have recently closed a €6.4 million Series A funding round to scale technology and enter new markets. We provide an online classroom collaboration e-learning platform developed in-house by our Tech team that has enabled 1.7M (20% of) Italian students not to miss school - the other 2 platforms were Google and Microsoft - and to amplify their learning experience by leveraging digital tools during the outbreak of the pandemic in 2020.

We are a young, fast-growing, and fast-paced team that values collaboration and innovation as keys to reaching our mission. Our company is home to over 60 full-time employees. And we plan to double our team in 2023 to push on our international growth with a full-remote first and objective-based approach.

We gather teams of experts from instructional design, software engineering, course development, educational video production, web marketing, and teacher & student engagement.
